cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the problem of computing minimum-area planar straight-line drawings of trees, which is a fundamental problem in computational geometry and graph theory. The paper focuses on the specific case of strictly-upward drawings of trees on a given grid, which is a common style for drawing rooted trees. This problem is closely related to computational geometry (cs.CG), as it involves geometric representations of graphs. It also involves data structures (cs.DS) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM), as the problem requires efficient algorithms for manipulating and analyzing graphs. The problem of minimum-area planar straight-line drawings of trees is also related to graph theory (cs.GT) and combinatorics (cs.CC), as it involves studying the properties of graphs and their combinatorial structures.
